properties.areaDesc: Van Buren; Warren; Overton; Grundy; Putnam; White; Cumberland; Fentress; Pickett
properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 12 at 11:29AM CST until February 13 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Nashville TN
properties.description:
...Moderate to Heavy Rainfall Expected Late This Afternoon and
Early Tonight...

.Rainfall rates of 2 inches in an hour can be expected this
afternoon and evening when a line of storms moves through the
mid-state. Total rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches, with locally
heavier amounts possible, will lead to an increasing threat of
flash flooding in the watch area this evening.

The Flash Flood Watch continues for

* A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following areas,
Cumberland, Fentress, Grundy, Overton, Pickett, Putnam, Van
Buren, Warren, and White.

* From 6 PM CST this evening through late tonight

* Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches with locally higher amounts possible.

* Rain showers will intensify late this afternoon and evening,
increasing the risk for flash flooding. Rapid rises on area
rivers, creeks, and streams will be possible.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT
